page.title: 17Recollections of Street (2)
page.content: Most enticing to{Mrs. Hart}was the hot,sticky{Chelsea bun}from Packe's the baker's shop{(Packey Doughnuts) obtained from a passageway at the rear {(Chelsea Lane). There was a great variety of shops including a large{Co_operative Store with{drapery,grocery}and{furniture departments.One of the most {fascinating sights}was the system of {giving change,}using a complicated network of overhead rails with cylinder containers for change which were shot and returned like{missiles. Local people were interesting too.One was{Percy Bartlett}who drove a{horse and cart,}carrying a {foul_smelling,moving grey mass}which was{rotting sheepskin from Morlands. For what purpose was unknown but {'jellies'}was the childrens suggestion.
